thread.title: Grammy Awards 2017 best dressed stars: Adele, Carrie Underwood, Paris Jackson and Demi Lovato steal the show
thread.title_full: Grammy Awards 2017 best dressed stars: Adele, Carrie Underwood, Paris Jackson and Demi Lovato steal the show

author: Zoe Shenton
title: Grammy Awards 2017 best dressed stars: Adele, Carrie Underwood, Paris Jackson and Demi Lovato steal the show
text:
The star-packed Grammys always deliver some of the most daring looks from awards season. 
And this year, stars shone in an array of bold colours, stripes, dazzing metallics and sexy sequins. 
Music heavyweight Adele, who has five nominations this year for 25, led the glamour in a gorgeous green custom Givenchy gown. 
We're used to seeing the singer in black or red, but the Hello star's ensemble perfectly complimented her hair colour and flawless make-up. 
Pop icon offspring Paris Jackson has been taking events by storm lately and looked fierce in a shimmering Balmain dress that featured cut-out panels and two thigh splits. (Photo: REUTERS) (Photo: REUTERS) (Photo: WireImage) 
Paris, whose extensive tattoo collection was on full display, complimented the look with a small purple clutch and chunky heels. 
Demi Lovato, who is up for best pop vocal album, dared to bare in a sparkling gold mesh dress that exposed a generous amount of cleavage. 
The bronzed babe, who had some extra-long extensions in for the bash, looked a picture of perfection as she posed on the red carpet at the Staples Center in Los Angeles. 
Supermodel Heidi Klum also made the best dressed list in her effortless metallic silver T-shirt dress which she paired with silver platform heels. (Photo: WireImage) (Photo: Rex Features) (Photo: WireImage) 
Vampire Diaries Actress Kat Graham stunned in one of the big trends of the season - stripes. 
The beauty cut an elegant figure in the red, white and black asymmetrical design. 
And bringing out some serious glamour, country megastar Carrie Underwood also wowed in an embellished red Elie Madi gown that featured a sexy, deep thigh split running up the middle.
